intro: Rubus rubristamineus, commonly known as the red-stamined blackberry, is a species of brambles native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. The flowers are white with five petals and are pollinated by insects.
